article.title: Efficient variational Bayesian neural network ensembles for outlier detection

multiple_choice_question.text:
This figure shows the performance of different ensembling methods for outlier detection. Which of the following statements is **CORRECT** based on the results shown in the figure? 

**(A)** Standard ensembles consistently outperform both Dropout-MC and the proposed method in terms of precision. 
**(B)** The proposed method achieves higher recall compared to Dropout-MC for both MNIST and notMNIST datasets.
**(C)**  Increasing the ensemble size always leads to improved precision for all three methods. 
**(D)**  Dropout-MC shows significantly lower recall compared to the other two methods.
choices: Standard ensembles consistently outperform both Dropout-MC and the proposed method in terms of precision.
The proposed method achieves higher recall compared to Dropout-MC for both MNIST and notMNIST datasets.
Increasing the ensemble size always leads to improved precision for all three methods.
Dropout-MC shows significantly lower recall compared to the other two methods.

multiple_choice_question.text:
This table presents the MNIST classification accuracy of different methods with various ensemble sizes using the SGLD learning rate schedule. Which statement is an **INCORRECT** interpretation of the table?

**(A)**  Standard ensembles achieve the highest classification accuracy across all ensemble sizes. 
**(B)**  The proposed method outperforms Dropout in terms of classification accuracy but falls short of standard ensembles. 
**(C)**  Increasing the ensemble size from 5 to 10 leads to a significant improvement in classification accuracy for the proposed method.
**(D)**  The classification accuracy of Dropout generally improves with a larger ensemble size.
choices: Standard ensembles achieve the highest classification accuracy across all ensemble sizes.
The proposed method outperforms Dropout in terms of classification accuracy but falls short of standard ensembles.
Increasing the ensemble size from 5 to 10 leads to a significant improvement in classification accuracy for the proposed method.
The classification accuracy of Dropout generally improves with a larger ensemble size.

multiple_choice_question.text:
This table presents MNIST classification accuracy using Adam for optimization. Which statement can be **CONCLUDED** from the table?

**(A)**  Using Adam for optimization results in lower classification accuracy compared to SGLD for all methods. 
**(B)**  The proposed method using Adam surpasses the performance of Dropout-MC across all ensemble sizes.
**(C)**  Increasing the ensemble size beyond 5 does not lead to noticeable gains in accuracy for any of the methods.
**(D)**  Dropout-MC consistently outperforms the proposed method when using Adam.
choices: Using Adam for optimization results in lower classification accuracy compared to SGLD for all methods.
The proposed method using Adam surpasses the performance of Dropout-MC across all ensemble sizes.
Increasing the ensemble size beyond 5 does not lead to noticeable gains in accuracy for any of the methods.
Dropout-MC consistently outperforms the proposed method when using Adam.

multiple_choice_question.text:
This formula defines a threshold for outlier detection based on the disagreement score. What is the role of the term "3Ïƒ(dtrain)" in this formula?

**(A)**  It represents the mean disagreement score calculated on the training data. 
**(B)**  It controls the trade-off between precision and recall for outlier detection. 
**(C)**  It signifies the maximum allowed disagreement score for an in-distribution sample. 
**(D)**  It scales the threshold based on the variance of the disagreement scores observed in the training data.
choices: It represents the mean disagreement score calculated on the training data.
It controls the trade-off between precision and recall for outlier detection.
It signifies the maximum allowed disagreement score for an in-distribution sample.
It scales the threshold based on the variance of the disagreement scores observed in the training data.
